elements.content: The synthesis and characterization of new tetramethoxy resorcinarene bis-crown ethers BC4 and BC5 are described. The complexation properties of the compounds toward alkali metal cations were studied by 1H NMR spectroscopy and X-ray crystallography, which revealed that BC5 can accommodate two cations simultaneously inside the crown pockets formed by the crown ether bridges and the resorcinarene skeleton.
elements.clean_text: The synthesis and characterization of new tetramethoxy resorcinarene bis-crown ethers BC4 and BC5 are described. The complexation properties of the compounds toward alkali metal cations were studied by 1H NMR spectroscopy and X-ray crystallography, which revealed that BC5 can accommodate two cations simultaneously inside the crown pockets formed by the crown ether bridges and the resorcinarene skeleton.

elements.content: In their simplicity, crown ethers are probably one of the most intriguing class of compounds in the field of supramolecular chemistry. They have been employed in numerous macromolecular assemblies such as catenanes and rotaxanes, as well as in calixcrowns, due to their remarkable ability to act as receptors or ionophores. Earlier studies of calixcrowns have shown the number of oxygens in the crown ether moiety to determine the selectivity toward cation binding in a manner comparable to the crown ether properties:  crown-4 is selective to sodium; crown-5 is selective to potassium; and crown-6 is selective to cesium cations, respectively. However, the conformation of the calixarene framework also influences the binding as providing cation−π interactions.
elements.clean_text: In their simplicity, crown ethers are probably one of the most intriguing class of compounds in the field of supramolecular chemistry. They have been employed in numerous macromolecular assemblies such as catenanes and rotaxanes, as well as in calixcrowns, due to their remarkable ability to act as receptors or ionophores. Earlier studies of calixcrowns have shown the number of oxygens in the crown ether moiety to determine the selectivity toward cation binding in a manner comparable to the crown ether properties: crown-4 is selective to sodium; crown-5 is selective to potassium; and crown-6 is selective to cesium cations, respectively. However, the conformation of the calixarene framework also influences the binding as providing cation-π interactions.

elements.content: Inspired by the work that has been done with calixcrowns, we wanted to explore the possibilities of introducing the crown ether properties to the resorcinarene skeleton. The phenolic hydroxyl groups on the upper rim of resorcinarene enable the crown bridging on the “open” end of the cavity and, therefore, make the resorcinarene bowl available to take part in the cation binding. We chose tetramethoxy resorcinarene as the platform because it has a limited amount of sites for crown ether bridging, which reduces the possibility of obtaining a complex mixture of products and, on the other hand, gives “handles” to the resorcinarene bowl-creating crown ether pockets to accommodate two guests.
elements.clean_text: Inspired by the work that has been done with calixcrowns, we wanted to explore the possibilities of introducing the crown ether properties to the resorcinarene skeleton. The phenolic hydroxyl groups on the upper rim of resorcinarene enable the crown bridging on the "open" end of the cavity and, therefore, make the resorcinarene bowl available to take part in the cation binding. We chose tetramethoxy resorcinarene as the platform because it has a limited amount of sites for crown ether bridging, which reduces the possibility of obtaining a complex mixture of products and, on the other hand, gives "handles" to the resorcinarene bowl-creating crown ether pockets to accommodate two guests.

elements.content: Herein, we report the synthesis of novel tetramethoxy resorcinarene bis-crown ethers BC4 and BC5 (named according to Jacques Vicens et al. as bis-crown followed by the number of oxygens3b). Also, their complexation properties toward alkali metal cations were studied using 1H NMR spectroscopic and X-ray crystallographic methods.
elements.clean_text: Herein, we report the synthesis of novel tetramethoxy resorcinarene bis-crown ethers BC4 and BC5 (named according to Jacques Vicens et al. as bis-crown followed by the number of oxygens3b). Also, their complexation properties toward alkali metal cations were studied using 1H NMR spectroscopic and X-ray crystallographic methods.

elements.content: Tetramethoxy resorcinarene bis-crowns BC4 and BC5 were accomplished by a reaction of triethylene and tetraethylene glycol ditosylates with tetramethoxy resorcinarene5 1 (Scheme ) with yields of 18 and 22%, respectively. The formed crown bridges over the adjacent aromatic rings force the resorcinarene skeleton to adopt a boat conformation, which can also be reasoned from the reduced symmetry in the 1H NMR spectra of BC4 and BC5 as doubling of the resonances arising from the resorcinarene core. Single crystals suitable for crystal structure analysis were obtained from methanol-chloroform (BC4) and acetonitrile (BC5) solutions. The longer crown ether bridge in BC5 allows the opposite upright aromatic rings of the resorcinarene core to tilt outward with an angle of 31.57° between the aromatic rings, where as in BC4 the angle between the aromatic rings is 9.60° (Figure ). Also, the crown pocket in BC4 has a cavity smaller than that of BC5 with average cavity diameters7 of 4.40−4.51 Å for BC4 and of 6.05−6.31 Å for BC5, thus making BC5 more favorable to guest inclusion.
elements.clean_text: Tetramethoxy resorcinarene bis-crowns BC4 and BC5 were accomplished by a reaction of triethylene and tetraethylene glycol ditosylates with tetramethoxy resorcinarene5 1 (Scheme ) with yields of 18 and 22%, respectively. The formed crown bridges over the adjacent aromatic rings force the resorcinarene skeleton to adopt a boat conformation, which can also be reasoned from the reduced symmetry in the 1H NMR spectra of BC4 and BC5 as doubling of the resonances arising from the resorcinarene core. Single crystals suitable for crystal structure analysis were obtained from methanol-chloroform (BC4) and acetonitrile (BC5) solutions. The longer crown ether bridge in BC5 allows the opposite upright aromatic rings of the resorcinarene core to tilt outward with an angle of 31.57° between the aromatic rings, where as in BC4 the angle between the aromatic rings is 9.60° (Figure ). Also, the crown pocket in BC4 has a cavity smaller than that of BC5 with average cavity diameters7 of 4.40-4.51 Å for BC4 and of 6.05-6.31 Å for BC5, thus making BC5 more favorable to guest inclusion.

elements.content:
<fig id="ol062138df00002" position="float">
<label>2</label>
<graphic xlink:href="ol-2006-02138d_0004.tif"></graphic>
</fig>

1H NMR spectroscopic titration experiments revealed the complexation abilities of BC4 and BC5 toward alkali metal cations (Li+, Na+, K+, Rb+, and Cs+). The titrations were performed in deuterated acetone at 293 K by adding subsequently increasing amounts of alkali metal salts with PF6 - as the counteranion. In solution, the crown ether moiety is fairly flexible and shows overlapping multiplets at the 4−3 ppm region of the 1H NMR spectrum (Figure ). When hosting cations, the crown ether bridge should adopt a more rigid form and thus simplify the spectrum in the crown ether region. In fact, with BC5, the addition of a 1:1 molar ratio of KPF6 did not cause any significant changes in the crown ether region of the spectrum, whereas with a 1:2 molar ratio of the cation, changes in the spectrum could already be seen. With a large excess of the salt, the spectrum continued to resolve in the crown ether region, indicating inclusion of K+ in the crown ether pocket. Small changes in the chemical shifts of the resorcinarene core were also seen, which implied changes in the conformation of BC5 and probable interaction with the resorcinarene core. A similar pattern was observed with RbPF6 and CsPF6, however, with the exception that with RbPF6 the changes in the spectrum were more or less identical but required a larger amount of the salt than with KPF6. With NaPF6, there were no significant changes in the spectrum. BC4 showed no reaction toward Li+, Na+, or K+ salts even at large excess, which would infer a cavity too confined for guest inclusion or competing solvation effects (for the sodium cation).
elements.clean_text: 1H NMR spectroscopic titration experiments revealed the complexation abilities of BC4 and BC5 toward alkali metal cations (Li+, Na+, K+, Rb+, and Cs+). The titrations were performed in deuterated acetone at 293 K by adding subsequently increasing amounts of alkali metal salts with PF6 - as the counteranion. In solution, the crown ether moiety is fairly flexible and shows overlapping multiplets at the 4-3 ppm region of the 1H NMR spectrum (Figure ). When  hosting cations, the crown ether bridge should adopt a more rigid form and thus simplify the spectrum in the crown ether region. In fact, with BC5, the addition of a 1:1 molar ratio of KPF6 did not cause any significant changes in the crown ether region of the spectrum, whereas with a 1:2 molar ratio of the cation, changes in the spectrum could already be seen. With a large excess of the salt, the spectrum continued to resolve in the crown ether region, indicating inclusion of K+ in the crown ether pocket. Small changes in the chemical shifts of the resorcinarene core were also seen, which implied changes in the conformation of BC5 and probable interaction with the resorcinarene core. A similar pattern was observed with RbPF6 and CsPF6, however, with the exception that with RbPF6 the changes in the spectrum were more or less identical but required a larger amount of the salt than with KPF6. With NaPF6, there were no significant changes in the spectrum. BC4 showed no reaction toward Li+, Na+, or K+ salts even at large excess, which would infer a cavity too confined for guest inclusion or competing solvation effects (for the sodium cation).

elements.content: Colorless single crystals of BC5·2KPF6·2MeCN·H2O were obtained from a reaction of BC5 with KPF6 (1:2 molar ratio) in an acetonitrile solution (Figure , top). Both crown pockets of BC5 host one K+ cation (K1 and K2), which both coordinate to four crown ether oxygens (K1···O18 2.817(3), K1···O60 2.853(3), K1···O57 2.860(3), and K1···O54 2.872(3) Å; K2···O4 3.113(3), K2···O49 2.799(3), K2···O46 2.926(3), and K2···O43 2.805(3) Å) and the aromatic ring (K1···C22−C27 3.149(2) Å; K2···C8−C13 3.198(2) Å) in the crown ether pocket. K2 additionally coordinates to one methoxy oxygen (K2···O20 3.020(3) Å) and a water molecule (K2···O70 2.735(4) Å).
elements.clean_text: Colorless single crystals of BC5⋅2KPF6⋅2MeCN⋅H2O were obtained from a reaction of BC5 with KPF6 (1:2 molar ratio) in an acetonitrile solution (Figure , top). Both crown pockets of BC5 host one K+ cation (K1 and K2), which both coordinate to four crown ether oxygens (K1⋅⋅⋅O18 2.817(3), K1⋅⋅⋅O60 2.853(3), K1⋅⋅⋅O57 2.860(3), and K1⋅⋅⋅O54 2.872(3) Å; K2⋅⋅⋅O4 3.113(3), K2⋅⋅⋅O49 2.799(3), K2⋅⋅⋅O46 2.926(3), and K2⋅⋅⋅O43 2.805(3) Å) and the aromatic ring (K1⋅⋅⋅C22-C27 3.149(2) Å; K2⋅⋅⋅C8-C13 3.198(2) Å) in the crown ether pocket. K2 additionally coordinates to one methoxy oxygen (K2⋅⋅⋅O20 3.020(3) Å) and a water molecule (K2⋅⋅⋅O70 2.735(4) Å).

elements.content: Ortep plot and vdw presentation of the complexesBC5·KPF6 (top, front view) and BC5·NaPF6 (bottom, front view). Non-hydrogen-bonding hydrogens and noncoordinating solvent molecules are omitted for clarity.
elements.clean_text: 3  Ortep plot and vdw presentation of the complexesBC5⋅KPF6 (top, front view) and BC5⋅NaPF6 (bottom, front view). Non-hydrogen-bonding hydrogens and noncoordinating solvent molecules are omitted for clarity.

elements.content: Two BC5·2K+ complexes are connected together to a dimeric capsule through coordination of K1 and K2 to their counter anions PF6 - (K1···F16A 2.785(3), K1···F13A 2.728(3), and K2···F11B 2.838(3) Å) in a way that K1 in the bottom part of the capsule (A) pairs up with K2 in the top part of the capsule (B) and vice versa, thus creating two K1···PF6 -···K2 bridges inside the capsule. The two water molecules included in the capsule, in addition to coordinating to K2, form a network through hydrogen bonds to both PF6 - anions inside the capsule (O70···F16A 3.111(4), O70···F14A 3.048(5), and O70···F14B 3.004(5) Å). The remaining two PF6 - counter anions outside the capsule take part in crystal packing.
elements.clean_text: Two BC5⋅2K+ complexes are connected together to a dimeric capsule through coordination of K1 and K2 to their counter anions PF6 - (K1⋅⋅⋅F16A 2.785(3), K1⋅⋅⋅F13A 2.728(3), and K2⋅⋅⋅F11B 2.838(3) Å) in a way that K1 in the bottom part of the capsule (A) pairs up with K2 in the top part of the capsule (B) and vice versa, thus creating two K1⋅⋅⋅PF6 -⋅⋅⋅K2 bridges inside the capsule. The two water molecules included in the capsule, in addition to coordinating to K2, form a network through hydrogen bonds to both PF6 - anions inside the capsule (O70⋅⋅⋅F16A 3.111(4), O70⋅⋅⋅F14A 3.048(5), and O70⋅⋅⋅F14B 3.004(5) Å). The remaining two PF6 - counter anions outside the capsule take part in crystal packing.

elements.content: The reaction of BC5 with NaPF6 or NaClO4 in acetone gave colorless single crystals of the complex BC5·NaPF6·2Me2CO and BC5·NaClO4·2Me2CO (Figure , bottom) with isomorphous structures. As seen in the 1H NMR titration experiments, the Na+ cation does not occupy the cavity of BC5 but instead lies in the notch of two resorcinarene hosts (A and B), which are approximately at a 90° angle on top of each other with the cavities facing one another. A sodium cation coordinates to two oxygens of the crown ether bridges of both resorcinarene hosts, which make up the inner walls of the notch (Na1···O43A 2.434(3), Na1···O46A 2.446(3), Na1···O57B 2.412(3), and Na1···O60B 2.496(3) Å), to the counteranion PF6 - or ClO4 - (Na1···F1 2.654(4) and Na1···F5 2.428(3) Å; Na1···O91 2.425(5) and Na1···O93 2.906(8) Å), and to one solvent acetone (Na1···O80 2.430(3) Å). A helical-like chain is eventually formed as the other crown ether bridge of the second resorcinarene host is free to coordinate to a second sodium cation, which coordinates to a third resorcinarene host, and so forth (Figure ).
elements.clean_text: The reaction of BC5 with NaPF6 or NaClO4 in acetone gave colorless single crystals of the complex BC5⋅NaPF6⋅2Me2CO and BC5⋅NaClO4⋅2Me2CO (Figure , bottom) with isomorphous structures. As seen in the 1H NMR titration experiments, the Na+ cation does not occupy the cavity of BC5 but instead lies in the notch of two resorcinarene hosts (A and B), which are approximately at a 90° angle on top of each other with the cavities facing one another. A sodium cation coordinates to two oxygens of the crown ether bridges of both resorcinarene hosts, which make up the inner walls of the notch (Na1⋅⋅⋅O43A 2.434(3), Na1⋅⋅⋅O46A 2.446(3), Na1⋅⋅⋅O57B 2.412(3), and Na1⋅⋅⋅O60B 2.496(3) Å), to the counteranion PF6 - or ClO4 - (Na1⋅⋅⋅F1 2.654(4) and Na1⋅⋅⋅F5 2.428(3) Å; Na1⋅⋅⋅O91 2.425(5) and Na1⋅⋅⋅O93 2.906(8) Å), and to one solvent acetone (Na1⋅⋅⋅O80 2.430(3) Å). A  helical-like chain is eventually formed as the other crown ether bridge of the second resorcinarene host is free to coordinate to a second sodium cation, which coordinates to a third resorcinarene host, and so forth (Figure ).

elements.content: Crystal structure (below, top view) of the helical chain formed by the complexBC5·NaPF6 and vdw presentation separating the dimers in different colors (above, side view; only the resorcinarene skeleton and sodium cations are shown). Hydrogens and noncoordinating solvent molecules are omitted for clarity.

Hydrogens and noncoordinating solvent molecules are omitted for clarity.

elements.content: Preliminary crystallization studies indicate the complexation of BC5 with RbPF6 and CsPF6, but the quality of the data was not good enough to be published. Attempts to get better quality crystals are underway.
elements.clean_text: Preliminary crystallization studies indicate the complexation of BC5 with RbPF6 and CsPF6, but the quality of the data was not good enough to be published. Attempts to get better quality crystals are underway.

elements.content: Alkali metal picrate extraction experiments from water into a chloroform solution of hosts BC4 and BC5 were performed (Table ). The results showed similar selectivity to Rb+ and Cs+ cations over K+ when BC5 was used as the host, and no extraction ability toward the Na+ cation was observed. This suggests better size complementarity to Rb+ and Cs+ cations in the crown pocket as well as contribution of the resorcinarene skeleton to binding by cation−π interactions in addition to the crown ether oxygens. No extraction ability toward Na+ and K+ cations was observed with BC4 as a host molecule.
elements.clean_text: Alkali metal picrate extraction experiments from water into a chloroform solution of hosts BC4 and BC5 were performed (Table ). The results showed similar selectivity to Rb+ and Cs+ cations over K+ when BC5 was used as the host, and no extraction ability toward the Na+ cation was observed. This suggests better size complementarity to Rb+ and Cs+ cations in the crown pocket as well as contribution of the resorcinarene skeleton to binding by cation-π interactions in addition to the crown ether oxygens. No extraction ability toward Na+ and K+ cations was observed with BC4 as a host molecule.

elements.content:
Alkali Metal Picrate Extraction Experiment a

host Na+ K+ Rb+ Cs+ BC4 0 0 − − BC5 b 0 1.7 7.6 7.6

a  Percentage (%) of picrate extracted from water into chloroform. b  Standard deviation of <0.01.

In conclusion, tetramethoxy resorcinarene 1 was used as the platform in the synthesis of resorcinarene bis-crowns BC4 and BC5 with two cation binding sites created by the crown ether bridging over the adjacent phenolic hydroxyl groups. The complexation abilities of the compounds with alkali metals were investigated by 1H NMR spectroscopic and X-ray crystallographic methods. BC5 was shown to accommodate two cations, one in each of the crown pockets, and thereby possible receptor activity toward potassium, rubidium, and cesium cations. In our future studies, we aim to investigate the complexation properties of the resorcinarene crowns in more detail in terms of binding affinity and selectivity toward different alkali metal cations.
elements.clean_text: In conclusion, tetramethoxy resorcinarene 1 was used as the platform in the synthesis of resorcinarene bis-crowns BC4 and BC5 with two cation binding sites created by the crown ether bridging over the adjacent phenolic hydroxyl groups. The complexation abilities of the compounds with alkali metals were investigated by 1H NMR spectroscopic and X-ray crystallographic methods. BC5 was shown to accommodate two cations, one in each of the crown pockets, and thereby possible receptor activity toward potassium, rubidium, and cesium cations. In our future studies, we aim to investigate the complexation properties of the resorcinarene crowns in more detail in terms of binding affinity and selectivity toward different alkali metal cations.

elements.content: Experimental procedures and characterization details for compounds BC4 and BC5; crystal data, structure refinement details, and CIF for BC4 and BC5; and the complexes of BC5 with KPF6, NaPF6, and NaClO4. This material is available free of charge via the Internet at http://pubs.acs.org.
